column4: Hello, I have a problem with VERY slow write speed to vfat-USB-sticks since jaunty...
known problem.. thats all I know.
Im stayin with Intrepid for now.  Jaunty is just too broke for me
Thanks. My temporary fix was to disable the new "flush" option for mounting, but that is not a final solution, I think... thanks for the info ! ^^
no prob.. the lack of fglrx support for my card has no solutution!
Oh... Glad to use nvidia, at least since the drivers became more stable. Even the proprietary driver does not work?
there is no proprietary driver, thats my point..  its either open source radeon or , open source radeon
one thats not supported no more
Oh, okay. My oldest Radeon here is a x1250 onboard which is still supported... so... bad luck for your card :(
i know..   In windows driver versions dont matter.. they do with xorg/ubuntu
im not missing out on anything anyway.. other than bug finding.
Yes... but if you're lucky, one of the free drivers might implement 3d accel ;-) Okay ^^.
radeon OSS driver does.. just not very well..
Mhm. Maybe furhter developement might improve it ^^.
maybe.   Im not waitin for maybe.
Okay ^^. So good luck for the future, I will now try to change my mount-options for usb :P Bye ;-)
